channel.title: Drumkit
channel.description:
I've been thinking about buying a drumkit for a while now, but as always my budget is tight.
So my question is, do you think a drumkit consisting of components of different brands that are bought via eBay(or similar sites) would sound nice? For instance, if I'd buy two base drums from 2 different manufacturers, but the same size, would you notice it?

item.title: Drumkit
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

it depends on what sound you want, if you dont care then it shouldnt be a problem

Read full topic

item.title: Drumkit
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

I’d say doing a fill on three toms that each have different types of shells and skins would sound pretty off, but whatever works I guess.

Read full topic

item.title: Drumkit
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:3, topic:317737”][quote author=inertia link=topic=414250.msg3050104#msg3050104 date=1260038447]
It wouldn’t make any different to the sound though, setting up a drum kit isn’t like tuning a piano.
[/quote]
Not true at all. The skins, shells, hardware and how tight the bolts are can all change the sound of a drum.[/quote]

Yes I know that, but as a set it makes little difference. Each drum isn’t calibrated relative to the others, and if something sounds way off he can easy adjust the skin tension.

Read full topic

item.title: Drumkit
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

inertia:

It wouldn’t make any different to the sound though, setting up a drum kit isn’t like tuning a piano.

Not true at all. The skins, shells, hardware and how tight the bolts are can all change the sound of a drum.

Read full topic

item.title: Drumkit
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

I doubt you’d be able to find all the components in the same colour, and having different brands stamped on each one would look a bit strange too. It wouldn’t make any different to the sound though, setting up a drum kit isn’t like tuning a piano.

Read full topic
